EngvarBdate=October 2013 Use dmy datesdate=October 2013 Infobox person image = Maisie Williams 2 SDCC 2014 (cropped).jpg imagesize = 220px caption = Williams at the 2014 [[San Diego Comic Con International]] birth_date = Birth date and age1997415df=yes birth_place = [[Bristol]], England, UK occupation = Actress, dancer years_active = 2011–present
'''Maisie Williams''' (born 15 April 1997)ref{{cite web|title=Maisie Williams|url=http://www.tv.com/maisie-williams/person/657601/biography.html|publisher=[[TV.com]]|accessdate=29 July 2011}}</ref> is an English actress and dancer. She is best known for her role as [[Arya Stark]] in the [[HBO]] television series ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', which earned her a [[Airlock Alpha|Portal Award for Best Supporting Actress – Television]] (2012), [[Airlock Alpha|Portal Award for Best Young Actor]] (2012), [[BBC| BBC Radio 1 Teen Award for Best British Actor]] (2013), [[2011 Scream Awards|Scream Award for Best Ensemble]] nomination (2011), and [[Young Artist Award|Young Artist Award for Best Performance in a TV Series - Supporting Young Actress]] nomination (2013).
==Early life== Williams was born in [[Bristol]],ref name="Bristol Post 23 March 2014"{{cite news|title=Bristol teenager Maisie Williams on leaving school at 14 to become star of Game of Thrones |url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/Bristol-teenager-Maisie-Williams-leaving-school/story-20843299-detail/story.html |accessdate=23 March 2014 |newspaper=[[Bristol Post]] |date=23 March 2014}}</ref> the youngest of four children of Hilary Williams (now Frances), a former university course administrator. She grew up in [[Somerset]].ref name="Bristol Post 23 March 2014"{{cite news|title=Bristol teenager Maisie Williams on leaving school at 14 to become star of Game of Thrones|url=http://www.bristolpost.co.uk/Bristol-teenager-Maisie-Williams-leaving-school/story-20843299-detail/story.html|accessdate=23 March 2014|newspaper=[[Bristol Post]]|date=23 March 2014}}</ref> She attended [[Clutton, Somerset|Clutton]] Primary School and [[Norton Hill School]] in [[Midsomer Norton]] before moving to Bath Dance College to study Performing Arts.ref name = "MeetMaisie"{{cite web|title=Meet Maisie Sean Bean's co-star in new TV series Game of Thrones |url=http://www.thisissomerset.co.uk/Maisie-starring-role-Sean-Bean/story-12340725-detail/story.html |date=27 January 2011 |work=thisissomerset.co.uk |accessdate=2 June 2013}}</ref>ref{{cite web|title=BDC Student Maisie Williams|url=http://www.bathdancecollege.com/videos/|accessdate=14 October 2013|work=Bath Dance College}}</ref>
==Career== [[File:Maisie Williams (March 2013) (headshot).jpg|thumb|Williams at the premiere of the [[Game of Thrones (season 3)|third season]] of ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', March 2013]]
Since 2011, Williams has played [[Arya Stark]], a [[tomboy]]ish young girl from a noble family, in the [[HBO]] fantasy TV series ''[[Game of Thrones]]''.ref name="TV Guide 2 June 2011"{{cite news|last=Nguyen|first=Hanh|title=Game of Thrones' Maisie Williams: I Did Try to Make Arya Left-Handed! |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Game-Thrones-Maisie-Williams-1033874.aspx?rss=keywords&partnerid=imdb&profileid=01|accessdate=29 July 2011|newspaper=[[TV Guide]]|date=2 June 2011}}</ref> It was her first role.ref name="Access Hollywood 13 June 2011"{{cite news|last=Spero |first=Jesse|title=Maisie Williams Talks ''Game of Thrones'' Shocking Death|url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/maisie-williams-talks-game-of-thrones-shocking-death_article_49207|accessdate=29 July 2011|newspaper=[[Access Hollywood]]|date=13 June 2011}}</ref> She received acclaim for her performance.ref{{cite news|last=Porter|first=Rick|title=''Game of Thrones'' review: Well-acted, beautifully shot fantasy for grownups|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2011/04/game-of-thrones-review-well-acted-beautifully-shot-fantasy-for-grownups.html|accessdate=29 July 2011|newspaper=Zap2It|date=17 April 2011}}</ref>ref name="The Telegraph 6 June 2011"{{cite news|last=Chivers|first=Tom|title=Game of Thrones, episode eight – The Pointy End, review|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/8560692/Game-of-Thrones-episode-eight-The-Pointy-End-review.html|accessdate=29 July 2011|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]|date=6 June 2011}}</ref> Williams continued to garner praise in the show's [[Game of Thrones (season 2)|second season]]ref{{cite web|last=Sims |first=David|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/the-ghost-of-harrenhal-for-newbies,72795/|title=“The Ghost of Harrenhal" (for newbies) | Game of Thrones (newbies) | TV Club | TV|publisher=The A.V. Club|date=29 April 2012|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref>ref{{cite web|url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2012/04/30/game-of-thrones-sails-into-darker-waters-with-ghost-of-harrenhal/2/|title='Game of Thrones' Sails into Darker Waters With 'Ghost of Harrenhal'|publisher=Forbes|date=30 April 2012|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref> and HBO submitted her for consideration as [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Supporting Actress]] at the [[64th Primetime Emmy Awards|2012 Primetime Emmy Awards]].ref{{cite news|first=Newsdesk|title=Let's peek inside HBO's Emmy FYC campaign package|url=http://www.goldderby.com/emmys/news/2774/let%27s-peek-inside-hbo%27s-emmy-fyc-campaign-package.html|accessdate=5 May 2012|newspaper=Gold Derby}}</ref> She won the 2012 [[Airlock Alpha|Portal Award]] for Best Supporting Actress ndash Television, and the Portal Award for Best Young Actor. At 15 years of age, Williams was the youngest actress ever to win the Best Supporting Actress category.refAirlock Alpha. {{cite web|title='Game of Thrones' Conquers With 4 Portal Awards|url=http://www.airlockalpha.com/node/9361/game-of-thrones-conquers-with-4-portal-awards.html|accessdate= 19 September 2012}}</ref> In March 2013 she was nominated for a [[Young Artist Award]] as [[34th Young Artist Awards#Best Performance in a TV Series - Supporting Young Actress|Best Young Supporting Actress in a TV Series]] and, in November 2013, won a [[BBC Radio 1]] Teen Award for Best British Actor.ref name="Young Artist Awards 34"{{cite web|url=http://www.youngartistawards.org/noms34.html|title=34th Annual Young Artist Awards|accessdate=31 March 2013|work=YoungArtistAwards.org}}</ref>ref{{cite web|title=BBC Radio 1's Teen Awards, 2013|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p01ktm3g.mp|accessdate=4 November 2013|publisher=BBC Radio 1}}</ref>
In 2012, Williams played Loren Caleigh in the [[BBC]] series ''[[The Secret of Crickley Hall (TV series)|The Secret of Crickley Hall]]'' and appeared in a ''[[Funny or Die]]'' skit titled ''The Olympic Ticket Scalper''.ref{{cite web|url=http://www.funnyordie.com/videos/2d26100ce3/the-olympic-ticket-scalper-with-patrick-stewart-ryan-lochte-simon-pegg-maisie-williams|title=The Olympic Ticket Scalper with Sir Patrick Stewart, Ryan Lochte, Simon Pegg & Maisie Williams from Patrick Stewart, Ryan Lochte, Simon Pegg, Maisie Williams, NickCorirossi, Charles Ingram, Betsy Koch, Funny Or Die, and Brian Lane|publisher=Funnyordie.com|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref> She also appeared in the [[independent film]]s ''Heatstroke'' (2012) and ''Gold'' (2013), and the short films ''Corvidae'' (2013) and ''Up On The Roof'' (2013).ref{{cite web|url=http://www.louisejohnstonmanagement.com/showpage.asp|title=Louise Johnston Management|publisher=Louise Johnston Management|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref>ref{{cite web|url=http://www.catandweasel.com/Cat_and_Weasel_Films____Corvidae.html|title=Cat and Weasel Films // Corvidae |publisher=Catandweasel.com|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref>ref{{cite web|url=http://www.louisejohnstonmanagement.com/showpage.asp?page=actor&RecordID=10|title=Louise Johnston Management|publisher=Louise Johnston Management|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref>ref{{cite web|url=http://flicksandthecity.com/up-on-the-roof-game-of-thrones-arya-maisie-williams/|title=Up On The Roof & Game of Thrones with Maisie Williams|publisher=Flicks and the City|accessdate=14 October 2013}}</ref> In addition, Williams has signed to play Lorna Thompson in the sci-fi film ''We Are Monsters'', which is currently in pre-production and set for a 2014 release.ref{{cite web|url=http://www.wearemonstersmovie.com/news/game-of-thrones-maisie-williams-joins-cast|title=Game of Thrones Maisie Williams Joins Cast of We Are Monsters!|publisher=Wearemonstersmovie.com|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref> Williams will also play as Lydia in the British film ''The Falling'', which is currently in post-production and set for 2014 release.ref{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/game-thrones-maisie-williams-joins-651158|title='Game of Thrones'' Maisie Williams Joins Cast of U.K. Film 'The Falling'|publisher=www.hollywoodreporter.com|accessdate=2 November 2013}}</ref>
